template.docs:
The `template` lock platform allows you to create simple locks out of just actions and an optional value lambda. Once defined, it will automatically appear in Home Assistant as a lock and can be controlled through the frontend.

*See also: [Template Lock](https://esphome.io/components/lock/template.html#template-lock)*

on_lock.docs:
**[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action)**: An automation to perform when the lock is locked. See [lock.on_lock / lock.on_unlock Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/lock/index.html#lock-on-lock-unlock-trigger).



*See also: [Lock Component](https://esphome.io/components/lock/index.html#base-lock-configuration)*

on_unlock.docs:
**[Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-action)**: An automation to perform when the lock is unlocked. See [lock.on_lock / lock.on_unlock Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/lock/index.html#lock-on-lock-unlock-trigger)..



*See also: [Lock Component](https://esphome.io/components/lock/index.html#base-lock-configuration)*

open.docs:
This action opens (e.g. unlatch) a lock with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [Lock Component](https://esphome.io/components/lock/index.html#lock-open-action)*

lock.docs:
This action locks a lock with the given ID on when executed.

*See also: [Lock Component](https://esphome.io/components/lock/index.html#lock-lock-action)*

unlock.docs:
This action unlocks a lock with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [Lock Component](https://esphome.io/components/lock/index.html#lock-unlock-action)*
